A Cisco router is running IOS 15. What a: local route interface ; directly connected interface
What is a characteristic of a hub?: regenerates signals received on one port out all other ports

agree with AP to share Open authentication ; initiate shared key authentication process

Which sentence correctly describes the S: An SVI is needed for each VLAN.
How are IP addressing designs affected b: Each VLAN must have a different network number.

What is the main difference between the: An IDS would allow malicious traffic to pass before it is addressed, whereas an IPS stops it immediately.
What is a characteristic of a WAN?: It connects multiple networks that are geographically separated.
What is a function of a proxy firewall?: connects to remote servers on behalf of clients
How is a source IP address used in a sta: It is the criterion that is used to filter traffic.
Which statement describes the Cisco Clou: It is a cloud-based security service to scan traffic for malware and policy enforcement.
What is a feature of the TACACS+ protoco: It encrypts the entire body of the packet for more secure communications.
What is an example of “hacktivism”?: A group of environmentalists launch a denial of service attack against an oil company that is responsible for a large oil spill.
Which statement describes cybersecurity?: It is an ongoing effort to protect Internet-connected systems and the data associated with those systems from unauthorized use or harm.
What focus describes a characteristic of: It focuses more on the motivation behind an attack and the means used to compromise vulnerabilities to gain access to assets.
What is the motivation of a white hat at: discovering weaknesses of networks and systems to improve the security level of these systems
What characteristic describes script kid: inexperienced threat actors running existing scripts, tools, and exploits, to cause harm, but typically not for profit
What characteristic describes a gray hat: individuals who commit cyber crimes but not for personal gain or to cause damage
A company has contracted with a network: to detect any evidence of a hack or malware in a computer or network
to probe network devices, servers, and hosts for open TCP or UDP ports
Which is an example of social engineerin: an unidentified person claiming to be a technician collecting user information from employees
What is a significant characteristic of: A virus is triggered by an event on the host system.
What is the purpose of a reconnaissance: to gather information about the target network and system
What is the primary goal of a DoS attack: to prevent the target server from being able to handle additional requests
What is the best description of Trojan h: It appears as useful software but hides malicious code.
When describing malware, what is a diffe: A virus replicates itself by attaching to another file, whereas a worm can replicate itself independently.
What is the main goal of using different: to prevent detection by network and host defenses
What is the purpose of a rootkit?: to gain privileged access to a device while concealing itself
In what way are zombies used in security: They are infected machines that carry out a DDoS attack.
What is the purpose of the Cisco NetFlow: to collect operational data from IP networks
Which capability is provided by the aggr: reducing the volume of event data by consolidating duplicate event records
What is an essential function of SIEM?: providing reporting and analysis of security events
Which network monitoring capability is p: Traffic exiting and entering a switch is copied to a network monitoring device.
What is involved in an IP address spoofi: A legitimate network IP address is hijacked by a rogue node.
How is optional network layer informatio: inside an extension header attached to the main IPv6 packet header
A threat actor uses a program to launch: Low Orbit Ion Cannon ; UDP Unicorn
Which action best describes a MAC addres: altering the MAC address of an attacking host to match that of a legitimate host
What is the result of a DHCP starvation: Legitimate clients are unable to lease IP addresses.
What is an objective of a DHCP spoofing: to provide false DNS server addresses to DHCP clients so that visits to a legitimate web server are directed to a fake server
How do cybercriminals make use of a mali: The iFrame allows the browser to load a web page from another source.
What is a characteristic of a DNS amplif: Threat actors use DNS open resolvers to increase the volume of attacks and to hide the true source of an attack.
How does BYOD change the way in which bu: BYOD provides flexibility in where and how users can access network resources.
What is a characteristic of a layered de: The failure of one safeguard does not affect the effectiveness of the other safeguards.
Which is a BYOD security best practice?: subscribe to a device locator service with remote wipe feature
What do security compliance regulations: what organizations are responsible for providing and the liability for failure to comply
Which two areas must an IT security pers: hardware used by applications ; important applications used
What is the biggest issue with local imp: Local implementation does not scale well.
What is an example of privilege escalati: A threat actor performs an access attack and gains the administrator password.
What is the principle of least privilege: Users are granted rights on an as-needed approach.
Which service is provided by the Cisco T: collecting information about active, existing, and emerging threats
What is the primary function of (ISC2)?: to provide vendor neutral education products and career services
What is the Common Vulnerabilities and E: It is a dictionary of CVE Identifiers for publicly known cybersecurity vulnerabilities.
What is the primary function of SANS?: to maintain the Internet Storm Center
Why do several network organizations, pr: to enable the exchange of CTI in an automated, consistent, and machine readable format
What is the primary purpose of the Forum: to enable a variety of computer security incident response teams to collaborate, cooperate, and coordinate information sharing, incident prevention, and rapid reaction strategies
Which statement is a feature of HMAC?: HMAC uses a secret key as input to the hash function, adding authentication to integrity assurance.
Which statement describes the use of cer: A class 5 certificate is more trustworthy than a class 4 certificate.
Which statement describes the term attac: It is the total sum of vulnerabilities in a system that is accessible to an attacker.
What is a host-based intrusion detection: It combines the functionalities of antimalware applications with firewall protection.
In Windows Firewall, when is the Domain: when the host is connected to a trusted network such as an internal business network
Which statement describes agentless anti: Antivirus scans are performed on hosts from a centralized system.
Which statement describes the threat-vul: It is the identification of threats and vulnerabilities and the matching of threats with vulnerabilities.
What are the steps in the vulnerability: discover, prioritize assets, assess, report, remediate, verify
A company decides to purchase a device c: The LBM probe messages may appear as suspicious traffic.
Which statement describes the function p: It allows users to browse the Internet anonymously.
How can NAT/PAT complicate network secur: It hides internal IP addresses by allowing them to share one or a few outside IP addresses.
Which two devices will create logs of su: Email security appliance ; Web security appliance
What is a feature of the tcpdump tool?: It can display packet captures in real time or write them to a file.
Which statement describes the tcpdump to: It is a command-line packet analyzer.
Which statement describes an operational: NetFlow collects basic information about the packet flow, not the flow data itself.
What function is provided by Snort as pa: to generate network intrusion alerts by the use of rules and signatures
What is the value of file hashes to netw: They can serve as malware signatures.
To ensure that the chain of custody is m: serial numbers and hostnames of devices used as evidence ; time and date the evidence was collected ; location of all evidence
Which action should be included in a pla: Develop metrics for measuring the incident response capability and its effectiveness.
Which two actions can help identify an a: Validate the IP address of the threat actor to determine if it is viable. ; Use an Internet search engine to gain additional information about the attack.
What is a MITRE ATT&CK framework?: a knowledge base of threat actor behavior
When dealing with security threats and u: Audit endpoints to forensically determine origin of exploit. ; Conduct employee awareness training and email testing.
What is the purpose of the policy elemen: It details how incidents should be handled based on the organizational mission and functions.
Which statement describes the Cyber Kill: It identifies the steps that adversaries must complete to accomplish their goals.
After containing an incident that infect: Update and patch the operating system and installed software of all hosts. ; Rebuild hosts with installation media if no backups are available. ; Use clean and recent backups to recover hosts.
Which task describes threat attribution?: determining who is responsible for the attack
What is the significant characteristic o: A worm can execute independently of the host system.
What are the three major components of a: a payload ; a propagation mechanism ; an enabling vulnerability
hacktivist: make political statements in order to create an awareness of issue that are important to them
vulnerability brokers: discover exploits and report them to vendors
state-sponsored attackers: gather intelligence or commit sabotage on specific goals on behalf of their government
What scenario describes a vulnerability: a threat actor attempting to discover exploits and report them to vendors, sometimes for prizes or rewards
What are two purposes of launching a rec: to scan for accessibility ; to gather information about the network and devices
What functionality is provided by Cisco: It mirrors traffic that passes through a switch port or VLAN to another port for traffic analysis.
What are three functionalities provided: It automates complex incident response procedures and investigations. ; It uses artificial intelligence to detect incidents and aid in incident analysis and response. ; It provides case management tools that allow cybersecurity personnel to research and investigate incidents.
Why would a rootkit be used by a hacker?: to gain access to a device without being detected
What causes a buffer overflow?: attempting to write more data to a memory location than that location can hold
It provides a complete audit trail of ba: ; It provides 24×7 statistics on packets that flow through a Cisco router or multilayer switch.
Which statement describes the function o: It copies the traffic from one switch port and sends it to another switch port that is connected to a monitoring device.
Which two characteristics describe a wor: is self-replicating ; travels to new computers without any intervention or knowledge of the user
Why would an attacker want to spoof a MA: so that a switch on the LAN will start forwarding frames to the attacker instead of to the legitimate host
Which two characteristics describe a vir: Malicious code that can remain dormant before executing an unwanted action. ; Malware that relies on the action of a user or a program to activate.
Why is asset management a critical funct: It identifies the ever increasing attack surface to threats.
